name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: The previous administration engaged in years of fiscal recklessness and mismanagement‚Äìbut this bill will work to set us on a new path for a better economy, a better climate, and a better future. #InflationReductionAct

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
It will also impose a 15% minimum tax for corporations making $1 billion or more in income. 

This means corporations that report billions of dollars in revenue to their shareholders, have to pay taxes on those earnings. #InflationReductionAct

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley

tweet_text:

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @jonfavs A üßµ on a few more of the life-saving provisions in the bill: https://t.co/lOamBoAhE4

tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats @RepAdams Stable housing improves physical and mental health as well as educational outcomes. Through a $65 billion investment, we will nearly eliminate the existing capital needs backlog for public housing, changing the lives of millions of Americans.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats @RepAdams Seniors will also have their out-of-pocket pharmacy costs capped at $2,000 per year thanks to Medicare's new ability to negotiate drug prices and penalize manufacturers who raise prices faster than inflation.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats @RepAdams For far too long, Medicare coverage failed to include hearing care and hearing aids. This legislation changes that. Now no senior will have to go without hearing benefits.

tweet_text:

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats My friend @RepAdams just reminded me that #BuildBackBetter also makes over $1 billion in historic investments in the health and care of moms! Together, we can save moms' lives and end racial and ethnic maternal health disparities.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats We have learned over the past two years how important it is to be prepared for pandemics. Our public health infrastructure will be significantly enhanced by a $1.3 billion investment in vaccine production capacity.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

This bill will finally close that gap and empower them to access low-to-no-cost, high-quality health plans.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats The Build Back Better Act will build on the success of the American Rescue Plan to make sure that health care is affordable and accessible for ALL families.

name: Mike Quigley

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

A new Methane Emissions Reductions Program will drive down methane emissions and establish a new charge for methane waste.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats Back in 2017, the Trump Tax cuts opened the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to fossil fuel development‚Äîthis legislation would protect this incredible, unique, and fragile landscape from fossil fuel excavation.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats In the 20th century, planners purposefully routed some highways directly through communities of color, cutting them off from schools, churches & more.

With a $2.3 billion investment, we will reconnect these areas, so communities of color have equal access to opportunities.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats We're replacing more than just USPS vehicles. Heavy-duty vehicles like trash trucks and school buses contribute to climate change AND release hazardous pollutants into communities. We're going to replace them with zero-emission alternatives so the air we breathe stays cleaner.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats The federal government must lead the way in the transition to electric cars. 

$5.9 billion will go toward electrifying the Postal Service vehicle fleet. That's enough to replace 70% of USPS trucks with climate-friendly electric vehicles.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats The transportation sector is the largest source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S.

To address this, we're dedicating $4 billion to lowering roadway emissions, including $950 million in grants for states that make progress towards reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats But we don't stop there.

Good public transit makes cities more accessible, livable, and cleaner. We're including $10 billion for Transit Oriented Development, to make sure that transit is actually serving our communities and getting people to and from where they need to go.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats The Build Back Better Act dedicates $200 million to improve climate and weather forecasting, $100 million to air quality research, and $365 million to climate-related Research and Development at NASA.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats Extreme weather events have brought the climate crisis front and center.

To tackle the most important issue of our lifetimes, we are passing the largest and most consequential climate change bill ever passed in the United States.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats Build Back Better provides $10B for child nutrition programs, meaning an additional 325,000 children in Illinois will be eligible to receive free school meals.

It also extends the Summer EBT program to ensure that no child goes hungry just because school is out of session.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats For school districts like Chicago, where it‚Äôs become difficult to retain teachers, $112 million in grants to recruit and train teachers from within our own community will mean more educators bringing their unique understanding of our city into our classrooms.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: @HouseDemocrats Too often formerly incarcerated people are left unprepared to reintegrate into the workforce. name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats While higher education may not be for everyone, everyone deserves the opportunity to have a good-paying job. 

We're providing $20 billion in workforce development funding for apprenticeship programs as well as career and technical training.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

We will change the lives of 162,000 students in Illinois alone who rely on Pell Grants.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:
@HouseDemocrats From the earliest age, children should have access to tools that put them on the path to success.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

#Juneteenth has been celebrated by Black Americans for over 150 years and it is long past time that we all honor this piece of both Black and American history.

I call on Congress to pass my Big Cat bill. I call on the @USDA to do a much, much better job enforcing the animal welfare laws we currently have on the books. 

But it‚Äôs not just about government.

I call on all of us to do better by the animals we share this planet with.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: But this is about each one of us understanding and acting as though every living thing deserves respect and nothing, no matter what species, deserves to suffer the way far too many animals in the United States are suffering right now.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: I'm the author of the #BigCatPublicSafetyAct and the Federal #BirdSafeBuildings Act. I'm a member of the Congressional Animal Protection Caucus and I'll do my part to make sure that our government is looking out for those who can't look out for themselves.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: ...rather than being shipped overseas to an uncertain fate. That story had a happy ending but I was still struck by the callousness and cruelty that lead to the situation in the first place.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: It's not just big cats. In August, twenty French bulldog puppies were abandoned in a warehouse at O'Hare airport and left in cages for days before being discovered by a policeman and rescued. One died. I was glad to help navigate the bureaucracy to ensure those dogs could stay...

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: As a pet owner, an animal lover, and a human being, I am disgusted by the thought of any animal being subjected to torture, abuse, and utter indifference from the day of its birth. We must be better than this.

tweet_text:

But it‚Äôs time for Congre‚Ä¶

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: Gun owners themselves support reform. That says it all. Responsible gun owners know their right to bear arms isn't being taken away. They know the only thing that will change is lives will be saved. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: The reason we have failed to make changes to gun legislation is simple. Republicans are more committed to the NRA than they are to saving lives. It's unacceptable. Republicans must act. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: I'm proud that @POTUS has taken action on gun violence. But now it's time for the Senate to step up, stand up for what is right, and pass the common sense gun legislation the House has put forward. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: Gun violence doesn't have to be the norm in America. Closing background check loopholes and banning assault weapons are common-sense policies with bipartisan support. It's time to make them the law. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: I echo President Biden's words tonight. Many of our law enforcement officers are good people, risking their lives everyday. We must support them while also working to combat systemic racism so no person loses their life to preventable police violence. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: No one should ever have to fear for their life during a police interaction‚Äîbut that's the reality for far too many Brown and Black communities in Chicago and across the country. I applaud @POTUS's efforts to end police violence and put our nation on a path toward racial justice.

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text:

We must continue the fight for justice if we want to create a future where NO ONE loses their lives to preventable police violence. #JusticeInPolicing #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
tweet_text: As @VP Harris has said, "A measure of justice isn‚Äôt the same as equal justice." The verdict against Derek Chauvin was an important step, but there is so much work left to be done. We must pass the George Floyd #JusticeinPolicingAct. #JointSession

tweet_text: The Trump administration pressured and ignored our intelligence experts. President Biden will listen to the experts and keep our nation safe. #JointAddress

name: Mike Quigley
